intro: Leptospermum candollei, commonly known as the white tea tree, is a small evergreen shrub native to Tasmania. It is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are typically covered in a dense layer of white, woolly hair. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are usually white or pale pink, which bloom in spring. Its aromatic foliage and ornamental flowers make it a popular choice for gardens. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun, thriving in coastal and temperate climates.
